Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Snuggle \Snug"gle\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Snuggled}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Snuggling}.] [Freq. of snug.] To move one way and the other so as to get a close place; to lie close for comfort; to cuddle; to nestle. [1913 Webster]

snuggle n : a close and affectionate (and often prolonged) embrace [syn: {cuddle}, {nestle}] v 1: move or arrange oneself in a comfortable and cozy position; "We cuddled against each other to keep warm"; "The children snuggled into their sleeping bags" [syn: {cuddle}, {nestle}, {nest}, {nuzzle}, {draw close}] 2: position comfortably; "The baby nestled her head in her mother's elbow" [syn: {nestle}]
